thread.title: The White House’s confusing statements about Frederick Douglass
thread.title_full: The White House’s confusing statements about Frederick Douglass

author: Kelsey Snell
title: The White House’s confusing statements about Frederick Douglass
text: The White House’s confusing statements about Frederick Douglass   Trump and press secretary Sean Spicer highlighted Frederick Douglass on Feb. 1, the first day of Black History Month. It was unclear from their statements if the two were aware that Douglass, the former slave, abolitionist, author and vice-presidential candidate, died in 1895.
